page.title: 12THE ECOLOGY OF RUNCORN
page.content: {1.Woodland. {Windmill Hill Wood and Big Wood.}Both these woods are within 1km of each other.Big Wood,once known as Northwood has existed for over 300 years.At present it is not open to the public,however young people on a government employment scheme are remaking long lost footpaths and laying out new ones ready for the woods to become a public amenity and nature reserve.Dominant amongst the trees is the Sycamore with approximately 500 counted. A much younger wood, the one at Windmill Hill is on the edge of a Development Corporation housing estate.It is much more open than Big Wood and is used widely as an area of recreation for joggers and walkers. Enviromental Rangers have planted many young trees particularly Beech and Oak
